verses.textLa: In peritia sua requirentes modos musicos, et narrantes carmina Scripturarum.

verses.textEn: There are men rich in virtue, who make a study of beauty, who live in peacefulness in their houses.
verses.textLa: Homines divites in virtute, pulchritudinis studium habentes: pacificantes in domibus suis.

verses.textEn: All these obtained glory in their generations, and they had praise in their days.
verses.textLa: Omnes isti in generationibus gentis suæ gloriam adepti sunt, et in diebus suis habentur in laudibus.

verses.textEn: They left behind a name for those who were born of them, so that their praises might be described.
verses.textLa: Qui de illis nati sunt, reliquerunt nomen narrandi laudes eorum:

verses.textEn: But for some of them, there is no memorial. They have passed away as if they had never existed; and they have become as if they had never been born, and their sons along with them.
verses.textLa: et sunt quorum non est memoria: perierunt quasi qui non fuerint: et nati sunt, quasi non nati, et filii ipsorum cum ipsis.

verses.textEn: But these were men of mercy, whose pious deeds have not failed.
verses.textLa: Sed illi viri misericordiæ sunt, quorum pietates non defuerunt:

verses.textEn: Good things continue with their offspring.
verses.textLa: cum semine eorum permanent bona,

verses.textEn: Their descendants are a holy inheritance, and their offspring stand firm in the covenants.
verses.textLa: hereditas sancta nepotes eorum, et in testamentis stetit semen eorum:

verses.textEn: And because of them, their sons remain even unto eternity. Their offspring and their glory will not be forsaken.
verses.textLa: et filii eorum propter illos usque in æternum manent: semen eorum et gloria eorum non derelinquetur.

verses.textEn: Their bodies were buried in peace, and their name lives on, from generation to generation.
verses.textLa: Corpora ipsorum in pace sepulta sunt, et nomen eorum vivit in generationem et generationem.

verses.textEn: Let the people declare their wisdom, and let the Church announce their praise.
verses.textLa: Sapientiam ipsorum narrent populi, et laudem eorum nunciet ecclesia.

verses.textEn: Enoch pleased God, and he was transferred to Paradise, so that he might offer repentance to the nations.
verses.textLa: Henoch placuit Deo, et translatus est in paradisum, ut det gentibus pœnitentiam.

verses.textEn: Noah was found to be perfect and just, and so, in the time of wrath, he was made a reconciliation.
verses.textLa: Noe inventus est perfectus, iustus, et in tempore iracundiæ factus est reconciliatio.

verses.textEn: As a result, there was a remnant left for the earth, when the great flood was made.
verses.textLa: Ideo dimissum est reliquum terræ, cum factum est diluvium.

verses.textEn: The covenants of the world were placed with him, so that all flesh would not be wiped away by the great flood.
verses.textLa: Testamenta sæculi posita sunt apud illum, ne deleri possit diluvio omnis caro.

verses.textEn: Abraham was the great father of a multitude of nations, and no one was found to be like him in glory. He observed the law of the Most High, and he formed a covenant with him.
verses.textLa: Abraham magnus pater multitudinis gentium, et non est inventus similis illi in gloria: qui conservavit legem Excelsi, et fuit in testamento cum illo.

verses.textEn: In his flesh, he caused the covenant to stand, and when tested, he was found to be faithful.
verses.textLa: In carne eius stare fecit testamentum, et in tentatione inventus est fidelis.

verses.textEn: Therefore, by an oath, he gave glory to him among his people, so as to increase him like the dust of the earth,
verses.textLa: Ideo iureiurando dedit illi gloriam in gente sua, crescere illum quasi terræ cumulum,

verses.textEn: and to exalt his offspring like the stars, and to give an inheritance to them from sea to sea, and from the river even to the ends of the earth.
verses.textLa: et ut stellas exaltare semen eius, et hereditare illos a mari usque ad mare, et a flumine usque ad terminos terræ.

verses.textEn: And he acted in like manner toward Isaac, because of his father Abraham.
verses.textLa: Et in Isaac eodem modo fecit propter Abraham patrem eius.

verses.textEn: The Lord gave the blessing of all the nations to him, and he confirmed his covenant upon the head of Jacob.
verses.textLa: Benedictionem omnium gentium dedit illi Dominus, et testamentum confirmavit super caput Iacob.

verses.textEn: He acknowledged him in his blessings, and he gave an inheritance to him, and he distributed to him the portion of the twelve tribes.
verses.textLa: Agnovit eum in benedictionibus suis, et dedit illi hereditatem, et divisit illi partem in tribubus duodecim.

verses.textEn: And he preserved for him men of mercy, who were found to have grace before the eyes of all flesh.
verses.textLa: Et conservavit illi homines misericordiæ, invenientes gratiam in oculis omnis carnis.

verses.textEn: Moses was beloved by God and men. The remembrance of him is a blessing.
verses.textLa: Dilectus Deo, et hominibus Moyses: cuius memoria in benedictione est.

verses.textEn: He made him like the holy ones in glory, and he magnified him by the fear of his enemies, and he appeased great portents by his words.
verses.textLa: Similem illum fecit in gloria sanctorum, et magnificavit eum in timore inimicorum, et in verbis suis monstra placavit.

verses.textEn: He glorified him in the sight of kings, and he gave commandments to him in the sight of his people, and he revealed his glory to him.
verses.textLa: Glorificavit illum in conspectu regum, et iussit illi coram populo suo, et ostendit illi gloriam suam.

verses.textEn: He made him holy by his faith and meekness, and he chose him from among all flesh.
verses.textLa: In fide et lenitate ipsius sanctum fecit illum, et elegit eum ex omni carne.

verses.textEn: For he heard him and his voice, and he led him into a cloud.
verses.textLa: Audivit enim eum, et vocem ipsius, et induxit illum in nubem.

verses.textEn: And he gave him precepts in his presence, with a law of life and discipline, so as to teach Jacob his covenant and Israel his judgments.
verses.textLa: Et dedit illi coram præcepta, et legem vitæ et disciplinæ, docere Iacob testamentum suum, et iudicia sua Israel.

verses.textEn: He exalted his brother Aaron and those who were similar to him from the tribe of Levi.
verses.textLa: Excelsum fecit Aaron fratrem eius, et similem sibi de tribu Levi:

verses.textEn: He established an eternal covenant with him, and he gave him the priesthood of the people, and he caused him to be blessed in glory.
verses.textLa: statuit ei testamentum æternum, et dedit illi sacerdotium gentis: et beatificavit illum in gloria,

verses.textEn: And he encircled him with a glorious belt, and he clothed him with a robe of glory, and he crowned him with virtuous attire.
verses.textLa: et circumcinxit eum zona gloriæ, et induit eum stolam gloriæ, et coronavit eum in vasis virtutis.

verses.textEn: He placed upon him a garment to the feet, and pants, and an ephod, and he wrapped him all around with many little bells of gold,
verses.textLa: Circumpedes, et femoralia, et humerale posuit ei, et cinxit illum tintinnabulis aureis plurimis in gyro,
verses.notes: The word ‘femoralia’ refers to an undergarment, similar to pants or shorts, which Jewish priests and Levites wore for the sake of modesty.

verses.textEn: so that there would be a sound at his arrival, and so as to make a noise that would be heard in the temple, as a memorial for the sons of his people.
verses.textLa: dare sonitum in incessu suo, auditum facere sonitum in templo in memoriam filiis gentis suæ.

verses.textEn: He provided him with a holy robe of gold and hyacinth and purple, a woven work for a wise man of judgment and truth,
verses.textLa: Stolam sanctam, auro, et hyacintho, et purpura, opus textile, viri sapientis, iudicio et veritate præditi:

verses.textEn: a work of twisted scarlet, the work of an artist, with precious stones, cut and set in gold, and engraved by the work of a jeweler, as a memorial according to the number of the tribes of Israel.
verses.textLa: torto cocco opus artificis gemmis pretiosis figuratis in ligatura auri, et opere lapidarii sculptis in memoriam secundum numerum tribuum Israel.

verses.textEn: He provided him with a crown of gold upon his headdress, on which was written a symbol of holiness, a mark of honor. This was a work of virtue and a delight to the eyes in its beauty.
verses.textLa: Corona aurea super mitram eius expressa signo sanctitatis, et gloria honoris: opus virtutis, et desideria oculorum ornata.

verses.textEn: Prior to him, there was no one of such beauty, even from the beginning.
verses.textLa: Sic pulchra ante ipsum non fuerunt talia usque ad originem.

verses.textEn: No foreigner was ever clothed with these things, but only his sons and his descendants alone, for all time.
verses.textLa: Non est indutus illa alienigena aliquis, sed tantum filii ipsius soli, et nepotes eius per omne tempus.

verses.textEn: His sacrifices were consumed by fire daily.
verses.textLa: Sacrificia ipsius consumpta sunt igne quotidie.

verses.textEn: Moses filled his hands and anointed him with holy oil.
verses.textLa: Complevit Moyses manus eius, et unxit illum oleo sancto.

verses.textEn: An eternal covenant was made, with him and with his offspring, like the days of heaven, to execute the office of the priesthood, and to give praise and to glorify his people, in his name.
verses.textLa: Factum est illi in testamentum æternum, et semini eius sicut dies cæli, fungi sacerdotio, et habere laudem, et glorificare populum suum in nomine eius.

verses.textEn: He chose him from among all living men to offer to God sacrifice, incense, and a pleasing fragrance, as a memorial of appeasement on behalf of his people.
verses.textLa: Ipsum elegit ab omni vivente, offerre sacrificium Deo, incensum, et bonum odorem, in memoriam placare pro populo suo:

verses.textEn: And he gave him authority by his precepts, in the covenants of his judgments, to teach Jacob his testimonies, and to give light by his law to Israel.
verses.textLa: et dedit illi in præceptis suis potestatem in testamentis iudiciorum, docere Iacob testimonia, et in lege sua lucem dare Israel.

verses.textEn: Then strangers stood up against him, and, because of envy, the men who were with Dathan and Abiram surrounded him in the desert, along with the congregation of Korah, in their anger.
verses.textLa: Quia contra illum steterunt alieni, et propter invidiam circumdederunt illum homines in deserto, qui erant cum Dathan et Abiron, et congregatio Core in iracundia.

verses.textEn: The Lord God saw this, and it did not please him, and so they were consumed by the force of his anger.
verses.textLa: Vidit Dominus Deus, et non placuit illi, et consumpti sunt in impetu iracundiæ.

verses.textEn: He wrought great portents among them, and he consumed them with a flame of fire.
verses.textLa: Fecit illis monstra, et consumpsit illos in flamma ignis.

verses.textEn: And he added glory to Aaron, and he gave him an inheritance, and he allotted to him the first-fruits of the earth.
verses.textLa: Et addidit Aaron gloriam, et dedit illi hereditatem, et primitias frugum terræ divisit illi.

verses.textEn: He prepared for them the finest bread unto fullness. And they shall also eat from the sacrifices of the Lord, which he gave to him and to his offspring.
verses.textLa: Panem ipsis in primis paravit in satietatem: nam et sacrificia Domini edent, quæ dedit illi, et semini eius.

verses.textEn: And yet he will not have an inheritance among the people of the land, and he has no portion among the people. For the Lord himself is his portion and his inheritance.
verses.textLa: Ceterum in terra gentes non hereditabit, et pars non est illi in gente: ipse est enim pars eius, et hereditas.

verses.textEn: Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, is third in glory, by imitating him in the fear of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Phinees filius Eleazari tertius in gloria est, imitando eum in timore Domini:

verses.textEn: And he stood up against the shamefulness of the people. By the goodness and responsiveness of his soul, he appeased God on behalf of Israel.
verses.textLa: et stare in reverentia gentis: in bonitate et alacritate animæ suæ placuit Deo pro Israel.

verses.textEn: For this reason, he made him a covenant of peace, a leader of the sanctuary and of his people, so that the dignity of the priesthood would remain with him and with his offspring unto eternity.
verses.textLa: Ideo statuit illi testamentum pacis, principem sanctorum et gentis suæ, ut sit illi et semini eius sacerdotii dignitas in æternum.

verses.textEn: And he made a covenant with king David, the son of Jesse from the tribe of Judah, an inheritance for him and for his offspring, so that he might provide wisdom for our hearts, so as to judge his people in justice, lest their good things be abolished. And he caused their glory within their nation to be everlasting.
verses.textLa: Et testamentum David regi filio Iesse de tribu Iuda, hereditas ipsi et semini eius, ut daret sapientiam in cor nostrum, iudicare gentem suam in iustitia, ne abolerentur bona ipsorum, et gloriam ipsorum in gentem eorum æternam fecit.

verses.textEn: Joshua, the son of Nun, was valiant in warfare; he was the successor of Moses among the prophets. He was great in accord with his name,
verses.textLa: Fortis in bello Iesus Nave successor Moysi in prophetis, qui fuit magnus secundum nomen suum,

verses.textEn: very great in saving the elect of God. He fought against the insurgent enemies, so that he might obtain the inheritance for Israel.
verses.textLa: maximus in salutem electorum Dei, expugnare insurgentes hostes, ut consequeretur hereditatem Israel.

verses.textEn: What great glory he secured, by lifting up his hands and throwing his spears against the cities!
verses.textLa: Quam gloriam adeptus est in tollendo manus suas, et iactando contra civitates rhomphæas!

verses.textEn: Who before him has stood so firmly? For the Lord himself led forward the enemies.
verses.textLa: Quis ante illum sic restitit? Nam hostes ipse Dominus perduxit:

verses.textEn: Was not the sun halted by his wrath, and one day made as if two?
verses.textLa: An non in iracundia eius impeditus est sol, et una dies facta est quasi duo?

verses.textEn: He called upon the Most High Power, when the enemies assailed him on every side. And the great and holy God answered him with hailstones of exceedingly great force.
verses.textLa: Invocavit Altissimum Potentem in oppugnando inimicos undique, et audivit illum magnus et sanctus Deus in saxis grandinis virtutis valde fortis.

verses.textEn: He made a violent assault against a hostile nation, and at his descent, he destroyed his adversaries,
verses.textLa: Impetum fecit contra gentem hostilem, et in descensu perdidit contrarios,

verses.textEn: so that the nations would acknowledge his power: that it is not easy to fight against God. And he followed the Almighty.
verses.textLa: ut cognoscant gentes potentiam eius: quia contra Deum pugnare non est facile. Et secutus est a tergo Potentis:

verses.textEn: And in the days of Moses, he accomplished a work of mercy. He and Caleb, the son of Jephuneh, stood against the enemy, and forbid the people from sin, and broke their wicked murmuring.
verses.textLa: et in diebus Moysi misericordiam fecit ipse, et Caleb filius Iephone, stare contra hostem, et prohibere gentem a peccatis, et perfringere murmur malitiæ.

verses.textEn: And these two, having been appointed, were freed from peril, from foot soldiers numbering six hundred thousand, so as to lead them into their inheritance, into a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.textLa: Et ipsi duo constituti, a periculo liberati sunt a numero sexcentorum millium peditum, inducere illos in hereditatem, in terram, quæ manat lac et mel.

verses.textEn: And the Lord gave strength to Caleb also, and his strength remained even in his old age, so that he ascended to the high places of the land, and his offspring obtained it as an inheritance.
verses.textLa: Et dedit Dominus ipsi Caleb fortitudinem, et usque in senectutem permansit illi virtus, ut ascenderet in excelsum terræ locum, et semen ipsius obtinuit hereditatem:

verses.textEn: This was so that all the sons of Israel would see that it is good to obey the holy God.
verses.textLa: ut viderent omnes filii Israel quia bonum est obsequi sancto Deo.

verses.textEn: Then there were the judges, each one called by name, whose heart was not corrupted. They did not turn away from the Lord,
verses.textLa: Et iudices singuli suo nomine, quorum non est corruptum cor: qui non aversi sunt a Domino,

verses.textEn: so that their memory might be blessed, and their bones might spring forth from their place,
verses.textLa: ut sit memoria illorum in benedictione, et ossa eorum pullulent de loco suo,

verses.textEn: and their name might remain forever, continuing in their sons, holy men of glory.
verses.textLa: et nomen eorum permaneat in æternum, permanens ad filios illorum, sanctorum virorum gloria.

verses.textEn: Samuel, prophet of the Lord, beloved by the Lord his God, established a new government, and he anointed leaders over his people.
verses.textLa: Dilectus a Domino Deo suo Samuel propheta Domini, renovavit imperium, et unxit principes in gente sua.

verses.textEn: By the law of the Lord, he judged the congregation, and the God of Jacob saw it, and so, by his fidelity, he was proven to be a prophet.
verses.textLa: In lege Domini congregationem iudicavit, et vidit Deus Iacob, et in fide sua probatus est propheta.

verses.textEn: And he was known to be faithful in his words. For he saw the God of light.
verses.textLa: Et cognitus est in verbis suis fidelis, quia vidit Deum lucis:

verses.textEn: And when fighting against the enemies, who stood against him on every side, he called upon the name of the Almighty Lord, with an offering of an inviolate lamb.
verses.textLa: et invocavit Dominum omnipotentem, in oppugnando hostes circumstantes undique in oblatione agni inviolati.

verses.textEn: And the Lord thundered from heaven, and with a great noise, he made his voice to be heard.
verses.textLa: Et intonuit de cælo Dominus, et in sonitu magno auditam fecit vocem suam,

verses.textEn: And he crushed the leaders of the Tyrians, and all the commanders of the Philistines.
verses.textLa: et contrivit principes Tyriorum, et omnes duces Philisthiim:

verses.textEn: And before the time of the end of his life in the world, he offered testimony in the sight of the Lord and of his Christ, that he had not taken a bribe from any flesh, not even so much as a shoe, and that no man made an accusation against him.
verses.textLa: et ante tempus finis vitæ suæ et sæculi, testimonium præbuit in conspectu Domini, et Christi, pecunias et usque ad calceamenta ab omni carne non accepit, et non accusavit illum homo.

verses.textEn: And after this, he slept. And he made known to the king and revealed to him the end of his life. And he lifted up his voice from the earth in prophecy, to abolish the impiety of the people.
verses.textLa: Et post hoc dormivit, et notum fecit regi, et ostendit illi finem vitæ suæ, et exaltavit vocem suam de terra in prophetia delere impietatem gentis.

verses.textEn: After these things, Nathan the prophet arose, in the days of David.
verses.textLa: Post hæc surrexit Nathan propheta in diebus David.

verses.textEn: And just as fat is separated from meat, so was David separated from the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Et quasi adeps separatus a carne, sic David a filiis Israel.

verses.textEn: He played with lions, as if with lambs, and he acted similarly with bears, as if they were lambs of the flock, in his youth.
verses.textLa: Cum leonibus lusit quasi cum agnis: et in ursis similiter fecit sicut in agnis ovium in iuventute sua.

verses.textEn: Did he not kill the giant, and take away the reproach from his people?
verses.textLa: Numquid non occidit gigantem, et abstulit opprobrium de gente?

verses.textEn: By lifting up his hand, with a stone in a sling, he threw down the boasting of Goliath.
verses.textLa: In tollendo manum, saxo fundæ deiecit exultationem Goliæ:

verses.textEn: For he called upon the Almighty Lord, and he swore with his right hand to take away the mighty man of war, and to exalt the horn of his people.
verses.textLa: nam invocavit Dominum omnipotentem, et dedit in dextera eius tollere hominem fortem in bello, et exaltare cornu gentis suæ.
verses.notes: The expression ‘dedit in dextera eius’ means to swear an oath by raising one’s right hand. Compare 1 Maccabees 11:62.

verses.textEn: So he glorified him amid ten thousand, and he praised him with the blessings of the Lord, by offering him a crown of glory.
verses.textLa: Sic in decem millibus glorificavit eum, et laudavit eum in benedictionibus Domini in offerendo illi coronam gloriæ:

verses.textEn: For he crushed the enemies on every side, and he eradicated his adversaries, the Philistines, even to this day. He broke their horn, even for all time.
verses.textLa: contrivit enim inimicos undique, et extirpavit Philisthiim contrarios usque in hodiernum diem: contrivit cornu ipsorum usque in æternum.

verses.textEn: In all his works, he gave thanks to the Holy One, to the Most High, with words of glory.
verses.textLa: In omni opere dedit confessionem Sancto, et Excelso in verbo gloriæ.

verses.textEn: With all his heart, he praised the Lord and he loved God, who made him and who gave him power against his enemies.
verses.textLa: De omni corde suo laudavit Dominum, et dilexit Deum, qui fecit illum: et dedit illi contra inimicos potentiam:

verses.textEn: And he appointed singers to stand opposite the altar, and by their voices he provided sweet music.
verses.textLa: Et stare fecit cantores contra altare, et in sono eorum dulces fecit modos.

verses.textEn: And he provided beauty for the celebrations, and he gave order to the times, even until the end of his life, so that they would praise the holy name of the Lord, and magnify the sanctity of God, from early morning.
verses.textLa: Et dedit in celebrationibus decus, et ornavit tempora usque ad consummationem vitæ, ut laudarent nomen sanctum Domini, et amplificarent mane Dei sanctitatem.

verses.textEn: The Lord purged his sins, and he exalted his horn forever. And he gave him the covenant of the kingdom, and a throne of glory in Israel.
verses.textLa: Dominus purgavit peccata ipsius, et exaltavit in æternum cornu eius: et dedit illi testamentum regni, et sedem gloriæ in Israel.

verses.textEn: After him, an understanding son rose up. And by means of him, he cast down all the power of the enemies.
verses.textLa: Post ipsum surrexit filius sensatus, et propter illum deiecit omnem potentiam inimicorum.

verses.textEn: Solomon reigned in days of peace, and God subjected all his enemies to him, so that he might build a house in his name, and prepare a sanctuary for all time. O how well-taught you were in your youth!
verses.textLa: Salomon imperavit in diebus pacis, cui subiecit Deus omnes hostes, ut conderet domum in nomine suo, et pararet sanctitatem in sempiternum: quemadmodum eruditus es in iuventute tua,

verses.textEn: And you were filled with wisdom like a river, and your mind exposed the world.
verses.textLa: et impletus es, quasi flumen, sapientia, et terram retexit anima tua.

verses.textEn: And you explained mysteries by means of parables. Your name became known to far off islands, and you were beloved for your peace.
verses.textLa: Et replesti in comparationibus ænigmata: ad insulas longe divulgatum est nomen tuum, et dilectus es in pace tua.

verses.textEn: The earth was in wonder over your canticles, and proverbs, and parables, and interpretations,
verses.textLa: In cantilenis, et proverbiis, et comparationibus, et interpretationibus miratæ sunt terræ,

verses.textEn: and over the name of the Lord God, who is known as the God of Israel.
verses.textLa: et in nomine Domini Dei, cui est cognomen, Deus Israel.

verses.textEn: You gathered gold like copper, and you multiplied silver like lead.
verses.textLa: Collegisti quasi auricalcum aurum, et ut plumbum complesti argentum,

verses.textEn: But you bent your thigh to women, and you were held by the power of your body.
verses.textLa: et inclinasti femora tua mulieribus: potestatem habuisti in corpore tuo,

verses.textEn: You brought a stain upon your glory, and you profaned your seed, so as to bring wrath upon your children, and to incite your foolishness,
verses.textLa: dedisti maculam in gloria tua, et profanasti semen tuum inducere iracundiam ad liberos tuos, et incitari stultitiam tuam,

verses.textEn: so that you would cause the kingdom to be divided, and an obstinate kingdom to rule from Ephraim.
verses.textLa: ut faceres imperium bipartitum, et ex Ephraim imperare imperium durum.

verses.textEn: But God will not abandon his mercy, nor will he corrupt or abolish his own works. And he will not perish the stock of the descendants of his elect. And he will not destroy the offspring of him who loves the Lord.
verses.textLa: Deus autem non derelinquet misericordiam suam, et non corrumpet, nec delebit opera sua, neque perdet a stirpe nepotes electi sui: et semen eius, qui diligit Dominum non corrumpet.

verses.textEn: Therefore, he left behind a remnant for Jacob and for David, from the same stock.
verses.textLa: Dedit autem reliquum Iacob, et David de ipsa stirpe.

verses.textEn: And Solomon had his end with his fathers.
verses.textLa: Et finem habuit Salomon cum patribus suis.

verses.textEn: And he left behind himself some of his offspring, as the folly of the nation:
verses.textLa: Et dereliquit post se de semine suo, gentis stultitiam,

verses.textEn: both Rehoboam, who had little prudence, and who turned away the people by his counsel,
verses.textLa: et imminutum a prudentia, Roboam, qui avertit gentem consilio suo:

verses.textEn: and Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, who caused Israel to sin, and who provided a way of sin to Ephraim. And their sins were multiplied exceedingly.
verses.textLa: et Ieroboam filium Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israel, et dedit viam peccandi Ephraim, et plurima redundaverunt peccata ipsorum.

verses.textEn: They thoroughly turned them away from their own land.
verses.textLa: Valde averterunt illos a terra sua.

verses.textEn: And they sought every kind of wickedness, even until punishment overwhelmed them, and freed them from every kind of sin.
verses.textLa: Et quæsivit omnes nequitias usque dum perveniret ad illos defensio, et ab omnibus peccatis liberavit eos.

verses.textEn: And the prophet Elijah arose like a fire, and his word burned like a torch.
verses.textLa: Et surrexit Elias propheta, quasi ignis, et verbum ipsius quasi facula ardebat.

verses.textEn: He brought a famine upon them, and those who provoked him in their envy became few. For they could not bear the precepts of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Qui induxit in illos famem, et irritantes illum invidia sua pauci facti sunt. Non enim poterant sustinere præcepta Domini.

verses.textEn: By the word of the Lord, he closed the heavens, and he brought down fire from heaven three times.
verses.textLa: Verbo Domini continuit cælum, et deiecit de cælo ignem ter.

verses.textEn: In this way, Elijah was magnified in his wondrous works. So who can say that he is similar to you in glory?
verses.textLa: Sic amplificatus est Elias in mirabilibus suis. Et quis potest similiter sic gloriari tibi?

verses.textEn: He raised up a dead man from the grave, from the fate of death, by the word of the Lord God.
verses.textLa: Qui sustulisti mortuum ab inferis de sorte mortis in verbo Domini Dei.

verses.textEn: He threw down kings unto perdition, and he easily shattered their power and boasting from his bed.
verses.textLa: Qui deiecisti reges ad pernicem, et confregisti facile potentiam ipsorum, et gloriosos de lecto suo.
verses.notes: Notice that ‘suo’ is singular, while ‘ipsorum’ is plural. The former refers to Elijah and the latter to the kings. Elijah was able to throw down kings from his bed (or couch); he did not even have to stand up to defeat them.

verses.textEn: He heeded the judgment at Sinai, and the judgments of punishment at Horeb.
verses.textLa: Qui audis in Sina iudicium, et in Horeb iudicia defensionis.

verses.textEn: He anointed kings unto repentance, and he chose the prophets who would follow after him.
verses.textLa: Qui ungis reges ad pœnitentiam, et prophetas facis successores post te.
verses.notes: The verb here is in the second person singular because the subject is represented by the pronoun ‘qui’ (who). But using ‘who’ in English when it is not a question is awkward, so the pronoun used in third person singular. Thus, ‘post te’ becomes ‘after him’.

verses.textEn: He was received into a whirlwind of fire, into a swift chariot with fiery horses.
verses.textLa: Qui receptus es in turbine ignis, in curru equorum igneorum.

verses.textEn: He is written in the judgments of the times, so as to lessen the wrath of the Lord, to reconcile the heart of the father to the son, and to restore the tribes of Jacob.
verses.textLa: Qui scriptus es in iudiciis temporum lenire iracundiam Domini: conciliare cor patris ad filium, et restituere tribus Iacob.

verses.textEn: Blessed are those who saw you, and who were adorned with your friendship.
verses.textLa: Beati sunt, qui te viderunt, et in amicitia tua decorati sunt.

verses.textEn: For we live only in our life, and after death, our name will not be the same.
verses.textLa: Nam nos vita vivimus tantum, post mortem autem non erit tale nomen nostrum.

verses.textEn: Certainly, Elijah was covered by the whirlwind, and his spirit was completed in Elisha. In his days, he was not fearful of the ruler, and no power defeated him.
verses.textLa: Elias quidem in turbine tectus est, et in Eliseo completus est spiritus eius: in diebus suis non pertimuit principem, et potentia nemo vicit illum.

verses.textEn: No word overwhelmed him, and after death, his body prophesied.
verses.textLa: Nec superavit illum verbum aliquod et mortuum prophetavit corpus eius.

verses.textEn: In his life, he gave great portents, and in death, he wrought miracles.
verses.textLa: In vita sua fecit monstra, et in morte mirabilia operatus est.

verses.textEn: In all these things, the people did not repent, and they did not withdraw from their sins, even until they were cast out of their land, and were dispersed throughout all the earth.
verses.textLa: In omnibus istis non pœnituit populus, et non recesserunt a peccatis suis usque dum eiecti sunt de terra sua, et dispersi sunt in omnem terram:

verses.textEn: And there was left behind a people very few in number, but with a leader in the house of David.
verses.textLa: et relicta est gens perpauca, et princeps in domo David.

verses.textEn: Some of these did what pleased God. But others committed many sins.
verses.textLa: Quidam ipsorum fecerunt quod placeret Deo: alii autem multa commiserunt peccata.

verses.textEn: Hezekiah fortified his city, and he brought water into its midst, and he dug into rock with iron, and he built a well for water.
verses.textLa: Ezechias munivit civitatem suam, et induxit in medium ipsius aquam, et fodit ferro rupem, et ædificavit ad aquam puteum.

verses.textEn: In his days, Sennacherib rose up, and he sent Rabshakeh, and he lifted up his hand against them, and he extended his hand against Zion, and he became arrogant in his power.
verses.textLa: In diebus ipsius ascendit Sennacherib, et misit Rabsacen, et sustulit manum suam contra illos, et extulit manum suam in Sion, et superbus factus est potentia sua.

verses.textEn: Then their hearts and hands shook. And they were in pain, like women giving birth.
verses.textLa: Tunc mota sunt corda, et manus ipsorum: et doluerunt quasi parturientes mulieres.

verses.textEn: And they called upon the merciful Lord. And they spread their hands and lifted them up to heaven. And the holy Lord God quickly heeded their voice.
verses.textLa: Et invocaverunt Dominum misericordem, et expandentes manus suas, extulerunt ad cælum: et sanctus Dominus Deus audivit cito vocem ipsorum.

verses.textEn: He was not mindful of their sins, and he did not give them over to their enemies. Instead, he purified them by the hand of Isaiah, the holy prophet.
verses.textLa: Non est commemoratus peccatorum illorum, neque dedit illos inimicis suis, sed purgavit eos in manu Isaiæ sancti prophetæ.

verses.textEn: He threw down the army of the Assyrians, and the Angel of the Lord crushed them.
verses.textLa: Deiecit castra Assyriorum, et contrivit illos Angelus Domini.

verses.textEn: For Hezekiah did what pleased God, and he went with fortitude in the way of David his father, just as he had been commanded by Isaiah, a prophet great and faithful in the sight of God.
verses.textLa: Nam fecit Ezechias quod placuit Deo, et fortiter ivit in via David patris sui, quam mandavit illi Isaias propheta magnus, et fidelis in conspectu Dei.

verses.textEn: In his days, the sun went backwards, and he added to the king’s life.
verses.textLa: In diebus ipsius retro rediit Sol, et addidit regi vitam.

verses.textEn: With a great spirit he saw the final things. And he consoled the mourners in Zion.
verses.textLa: Spiritu magno vidit ultima, et consolatus est lugentes in Sion.

verses.textEn: He revealed the future, even the distant future, and hidden things before they occurred.
verses.textLa: Usque in sempiternum ostendit futura et abscondita antequam evenirent.

verses.textEn: The memory of Josiah is like a blend of fragrances composed by the work of a perfumer.
verses.textLa: Memoria Iosiæ in compositionem odoris facta opus pigmentarii.

verses.textEn: His remembrance will be sweet like honey in every mouth, and like music at a banquet of wine.
verses.textLa: In omni ore quasi mel indulcabitur eius memoria, et ut musica in convivio vini.

verses.textEn: He was divinely directed for the repentance of the nation, and he took away the abominations of impiety.
verses.textLa: Ipse est directus divinitus in pœnitentiam gentis, et tulit abominationes impietatis.

verses.textEn: And he guided his heart toward the Lord. And during the days of sinners, he strengthened piety.
verses.textLa: Et gubernavit ad Dominum cor ipsius, et in diebus peccatorum corroboravit pietatem.

verses.textEn: Other than David, and Hezekiah, and Josiah, everyone committed sin.
verses.textLa: Præter David, et Ezechiam, et Iosiam, omnes peccatum commiserunt:

verses.textEn: For the kings of Judah abandoned the law of the Most High, and they held contempt for the fear of God.
verses.textLa: nam reliquerunt legem Altissimi reges Iuda, et contempserunt timorem Dei.

verses.textEn: For they gave their kingdom to foreigners, and their glory to a strange people.
verses.textLa: Dederunt enim regnum suum aliis, et gloriam suam alienigenæ genti.

verses.textEn: They set fire to the chosen city of sanctity, and they made its streets desolate, in accord with the hand of Jeremiah.
verses.textLa: Incenderunt electam sanctitatis civitatem, et desertas fecerunt vias ipsius in manu Ieremiæ.

verses.textEn: For they treated him wickedly, though he was consecrated as a prophet from his mother’s womb: to overthrow, and to root out, and to destroy, and also to rebuild and to renew.
verses.textLa: Nam male tractaverunt illum, qui a ventre matris consecratus est propheta, evertere, et eruere, et perdere, et iterum ædificare, et renovare.

verses.textEn: It was Ezekiel who saw a vision of glory, which was revealed to him with the chariot of the Cherubim.
verses.textLa: Ezechiel qui vidit conspectum gloriæ, quam ostendit illi in curru Cherubim.

verses.textEn: For it called to mind the enemies under the figure of rain, to do good to those who have revealed the upright ways.
verses.textLa: Nam commemoratus est inimicorum in imbre, benefacere illis, qui ostenderunt rectas vias.

verses.textEn: And may the bones of the twelve prophets spring up from their place. For they strengthened Jacob, and they redeemed themselves with a virtuous faith.
verses.textLa: Et duodecim prophetarum ossa pullulent de loco suo: nam corroboraverunt Iacob, et redemerunt se in fide virtutis.

verses.textEn: How will we magnify Zerubbabel? For he, too, was like a signet on the right hand.
verses.textLa: Quomodo amplificemus Zorobabel? Nam et ipse quasi signum in dextera manu,

verses.textEn: So also was Jesus, the son of Jozadak, who in their days built the house, and raised up a holy temple to the Lord, as a preparation for everlasting glory.
verses.textLa: sic et Iesum filium Iosedec: qui in diebus suis ædificaverunt domum, et exaltaverunt templum sanctum Domino, paratum in gloriam sempiternam.

verses.textEn: And may Nehemiah be remembered for a long time. He raised up for us the walls that had been torn down. And he made firm the gates and the bars. He raised up our houses.
verses.textLa: Et Nehemias in memoriam multi temporis, qui erexit nobis muros eversos, et stare fecit portas et seras, qui erexit domos nostras.

verses.textEn: No one has been born upon the earth like Enoch. And he was also taken up from the earth.
verses.textLa: Nemo natus est in terra qualis Henoch: nam et ipse receptus est a terra.

verses.textEn: And there was no one like Joseph, who was a man born to be foremost among his brothers, the firmament of his clan, a guide to his brethren, the mainstay of his people.
verses.textLa: Neque ut Ioseph, qui natus est homo, princeps fratrum, firmamentum gentis, rector fratrum, stabilimentum populi:

verses.textEn: And his bones were visited, and after death, they prophesied.
verses.textLa: et ossa ipsius visitata sunt, et post mortem prophetaverunt.

verses.textEn: Shem and Seth obtained glory among men. And above every soul, at the very beginning, was Adam.
verses.textLa: Seth, et Sem apud homines gloriam adepti sunt: et super omnem animam in origine Adam.

verses.textEn: Simon, the high priest, son of Onias: in his life, he propped up the house, and in his days, he strengthened the temple.
verses.textLa: Simon Oniæ filius, sacerdos magnus, qui in vita sua suffulsit domum, et in diebus suis corroboravit templum.

verses.textEn: Even the height of the temple was established by him: the double building and the high walls of the temple.
verses.textLa: Templi etiam altitudo ab ipso fundata est, duplex ædificatio et excelsi parietes templi.

verses.textEn: In his days, waters flowed out from the wells, and these were full beyond measure, like the sea.
verses.textLa: In diebus ipsius emanaverunt putei aquarum, et quasi mare adimpleti sunt supra modum.

verses.textEn: He cared for his nation, and he freed it from perdition.
verses.textLa: Qui curavit gentem suam, et liberavit eam a perditione.

verses.textEn: He prevailed, so as to enlarge the city. And he obtained glory by his behavior among the people. And he enlarged the entrance of the house and of the atrium.
verses.textLa: Qui prævaluit amplificare civitatem, qui adeptus est gloriam in conversatione gentis: et ingressum domus, et atrii amplificavit.

verses.textEn: He shined in his days like the morning star through the midst of a cloud, and like the full moon.
verses.textLa: Quasi stella matutina in medio nebulæ, et quasi luna plena in diebus suis lucet.

verses.textEn: And he shined forth in the temple of God in this manner: like the sun when it shines brightly,
verses.textLa: Et quasi Sol refulgens, sic ille effulsit in templo Dei.

verses.textEn: and like a rainbow shining amid clouds of glory, and like flowering roses in the days of spring, and like lilies along the water’s edge, and like sweet smelling frankincense in the days of summer,
verses.textLa: Quasi arcus refulgens inter nebulas gloriæ, et quasi flos rosarum in diebus vernis, et quasi lilia quæ sunt in transitu aquæ, et quasi thus redolens in diebus æstatis.

verses.textEn: like a fire shining brightly, and like frankincense burning within a fire,
verses.textLa: Quasi ignis effulgens, et thus ardens in igne.

verses.textEn: like a vessel of solid gold, adorned with every precious stone,
verses.textLa: Quasi vas auri solidum, ornatum omni lapide pretioso.

verses.textEn: like an olive tree producing buds, and like a cypress tree lifting itself on high, when he received the robe of glory and was vested with the consummation of virtue.
verses.textLa: Quasi oliva pullulans, et cypressus in altitudinem se extollens, in accipiendo ipsum stolam gloriæ, et vestiri eum in consummationem virtutis.

verses.textEn: He gave glory to the vestment of sanctity, when he ascended to the holy altar.
verses.textLa: In ascensu altaris sancti, gloriam dedit sanctitatis amictum.

verses.textEn: Then, when he received the portions from the hands of the priests, he himself stood next to the altar. And around him was the crown of his brethren, like a cedar planted on a mountain of Lebanon.
verses.textLa: In accipiendo autem partes de manu sacerdotum, et ipse stans iuxta aram. Et circa illum corona fratrum: quasi plantatio cedri in monte Libano,

verses.textEn: And they stood around him like palm branches, and all were sons of Aaron in their glory.
verses.textLa: sic circa illum steterunt quasi rami palmæ, et omnes filii Aaron in gloria sua.

verses.textEn: Then the oblation of the Lord was in their hands, in the sight of the entire synagogue of Israel. And completing his service at the altar, so as to magnify the offering to the Most High King,
verses.textLa: Oblatio autem Domini in manibus ipsorum, coram omni synagoga Israel: et consummatione fungens in ara, amplificare oblationem Excelsi Regis,

verses.textEn: he extended his hand to make a libation, and he offered from the blood of the grape.
verses.textLa: porrexit manum suam in libatione, et libavit de sanguine uvæ.

verses.textEn: At the base of the altar, he poured out a divine fragrance to the Most High Prince.
verses.textLa: Effudit in fundamento altaris odorem divinum Excelso Principi.

verses.textEn: Then the sons of Aaron shouted; they sounded finely-made trumpets, and they made a great noise, as a memorial in the sight of God.
verses.textLa: Tunc exclamaverunt filii Aaron, in tubis productilibus sonuerunt, et auditam fecerunt vocem magnam in memoriam coram Deo.

verses.textEn: Then all the people at once hurried forward, and they fell to the ground on their faces, to adore the Lord their God, and to offer prayers to Almighty God Most High.
verses.textLa: Tunc omnis populus simul properaverunt, et ceciderunt in faciem super terram, adorare Dominum Deum suum, et dare preces omnipotenti Deo excelso.

verses.textEn: And the singers of Psalms raised their voices, and a full sweet sound increased in the great house.
verses.textLa: Et amplificaverunt psallentes in vocibus suis, et in magna domo auctus est sonus suavitatis plenus.

verses.textEn: And the people petitioned the Most High Lord in prayer, even until the honor of the Lord was completed, and they finished offering their gifts.
verses.textLa: Et rogavit populus Dominum excelsum in prece, usque dum perfectus est honor Domini, et munus suum perfecerunt.

verses.textEn: Then, descending, he extended his hands over the entire congregation of the sons of Israel, to give glory to God from his lips, and to glory in his name.
verses.textLa: Tunc descendens, manus suas extulit in omne congregationem filiorum Israel dare gloriam Deo a labiis suis, et in nomine ipsius gloriari:

verses.textEn: And he repeated his prayer, wanting to reveal the virtue of God.
verses.textLa: et iteravit orationem suam, volens ostendere virtutem Dei.

verses.textEn: And now, pray to the God of all, who has accomplished great things over all the earth, who has increased our days from our mother’s womb, and who has acted toward us in accord with his mercy.
verses.textLa: Et nunc orate Deum omnium, qui magna fecit in omni terra, qui auxit dies nostros a ventre matris nostræ, et fecit nobiscum secundum suam misericordiam:

verses.textEn: May he give us joyfulness in heart, and may there be peace in our days, in Israel for unending days,
verses.textLa: det nobis iucunditatem cordis, et fieri pacem in diebus nostris in Israel per dies sempiternos:

verses.textEn: so that Israel may trust the mercy of God to be with us, in order to free us in his days.
verses.textLa: credere Israel nobiscum esse Dei misericordiam, ut liberet nos in diebus suis.

verses.textEn: Two nations my soul hates, and a third, which I hate, is not a nation:
verses.textLa: Duas gentes odit anima mea: tertia autem non est gens, quam oderim:

verses.textEn: those who sit upon mount Seir, and the Philistines, and the foolish people who live at Shechem.
verses.textLa: qui sedent in monte Seir, et Philisthiim, et stultus populus, qui habitat in Sichimis.

verses.textEn: Jesus, the son of Sirach, of Jerusalem, who renewed wisdom from his heart, wrote the doctrine of wisdom and discipline in this book.
verses.textLa: Doctrinam sapientiæ et disciplinæ scripsit in codice isto Iesus filius Sirach Ierosolymita, qui renovavit sapientiam de corde suo.

verses.textEn: Blessed is he who lives by these good things. Whoever places these things in his heart will be ever wise.
verses.textLa: Beatus, qui in istis versatur bonis: qui ponit illa in corde suo, sapiens erit semper.

verses.textEn: For if he does these things, he will prevail in all things. For the light of God is upon his footsteps.
verses.textLa: Si enim hæc fecerit, ad omnia valebit: quia lux Dei, vestigium eius est.

verses.textEn: The prayer of Jesus, the son of Sirach: I will confess to you, O Lord and King, and I will give praise to you, O God my Savior.
verses.textLa: Oratio Iesu filii Sirach: Confitebor tibi Domine, Rex, et collaudabo te Deum, Salvatorem meum.

verses.textEn: I will acknowledge your name. For you have been my Helper and Protector.
verses.textLa: Confitebor nomini tuo: quoniam Adiutor et Protector factus es mihi,

verses.textEn: And you have freed my body from perdition, from the snare of the iniquitous tongue, and from the lips of those who forge lies. And you have been my Helper in the sight of those who stood nearby.
verses.textLa: et liberasti corpus meum a perditione, a laqueo linguæ iniquæ, et a labiis operantium mendacium, et in conspectu astantium factus es mihi Adiutor.

verses.textEn: And you have freed me according to the multitude of the mercy of your name: from those who roared and prepared to devour,
verses.textLa: Et liberasti me secundum multitudinem misericordiæ nominis tui a rugientibus, præparatis ad escam,

verses.textEn: from the hands of those who sought my life, and from the gates of tribulation that surrounded me,
verses.textLa: de manibus quærentium animam meam, et de portis tribulationum quæ circumdederunt me:

verses.textEn: from the oppression of the flames that surrounded me, and so I was not burned in the midst of the fire,
verses.textLa: a pressura flammæ, quæ circumdedit me, et in medio ignis non sum æstuatus:

verses.textEn: from the depths of the bowels of hell, and from the defiled tongue, and from lying words, from an iniquitous king, and from an unjust tongue.
verses.textLa: de altitudine ventris inferi, et a lingua coinquinata, et a verbo mendacii, a rege iniquo, et a lingua iniusta:

verses.textEn: My soul shall praise the Lord, even unto death.
verses.textLa: laudabit usque ad mortem anima mea Dominum,

verses.textEn: For my life was drawing near to hell below.
verses.textLa: et vita mea appropinquans erat in inferno deorsum.

verses.textEn: And they surrounded me on every side. And there was no one who would help me. I looked around for the assistance of men, and there was none.
verses.textLa: Circumdederunt me undique, et non erat qui adiuvaret. Respiciens eram ad adiutorium hominum, et non erat.

verses.textEn: Then I remembered your mercy, O Lord, and your works, which are from the very beginning.
verses.textLa: Memoratus sum misericordiæ tuæ Domine, et operationis tuæ, quæ a sæculo sunt.

verses.textEn: For you rescue those who persevere for you, O Lord, and you free them from the hands of the Gentiles.
verses.textLa: Quoniam eruis sustinentes te Domine, et liberas eos de manibus gentium.
verses.notes: In the Christian interpretation of Scripture, the Gentiles would refer to non-believers (heathens), not to non-Jews.

verses.textEn: You exalted my habitation upon the earth, and I made supplication that death would pass away.
verses.textLa: Exaltasti super terram habitationem meam, et pro morte defluente deprecatus sum.

verses.textEn: I called upon the Lord, the Father of my Lord, so that he would not abandon me in the day of my tribulation, nor in the time of arrogance without assistance.
verses.textLa: Invocavi Dominum, Patrem Domini mei, ut non derelinquat me in die tribulationis meæ, et in tempore superborum sine adiutorio.

verses.textEn: I will praise your name unceasingly, and I will praise it with thanksgiving, for my prayer was heeded.
verses.textLa: Laudabo nomen tuum assidue, et collaudabo illud in confessione, et exaudita est oratio mea.

verses.textEn: And you freed me from perdition, and you rescued me from the time of iniquity.
verses.textLa: Et liberasti me de perditione, et eripuisti me de tempore iniquo.

verses.textEn: Because of this, I will give thanks and praise to you, and I will bless the name of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Propterea confitebor, et laudem dicam tibi, et benedicam nomini Domini.

verses.textEn: When I was still young, before I wandered astray, I sought wisdom openly in my prayer.
verses.textLa: Cum adhuc iunior essem, priusquam oberrarem, quæsivi sapientiam palam in oratione mea.

verses.textEn: I asked for her before the temple, and even to the very end, I will inquire after her. And she flourished like a newly-ripened grape.
verses.textLa: Ante templum postulabam pro illis, et usque in novissimis inquiram eam. Et effloruit tamquam præcox uva,

verses.textEn: My heart rejoiced in her. My feet walked in the right path. From my youth, I pursued her.
verses.textLa: lætatum est cor meum in ea. Ambulavit pes meus iter rectum, a iuventute mea investigabam eam.

verses.textEn: I bent my ear a little and accepted her.
verses.textLa: Inclinavi modico aurem meam, et excepi illam.

verses.textEn: I found much wisdom within myself, and I benefited greatly by her.
verses.textLa: Multam inveni in meipso sapientiam, et multum profeci in ea.

verses.textEn: I will give glory to him who gives wisdom to me.
verses.textLa: Danti mihi sapientiam, dabo gloriam.

verses.textEn: For I have decided that I should act according to wisdom. I have been zealous for what is good, and so I will not be confounded.
verses.textLa: Consiliatus sum enim ut facerem illam: zelatus sum bonum, et non confundar.

verses.textEn: My soul has struggled for wisdom, and in doing so, I have been confirmed.
verses.textLa: Colluctata est anima mea in illa, et in faciendo eam confirmatus sum.

verses.textEn: I extended my hands on high, and I mourned my ignorance of her.
verses.textLa: Manus meas extendi in altum, et insipientiam eius luxi.

verses.textEn: I directed my soul toward her, and I found her within knowledge.
verses.textLa: Animam meam direxi ad illam, et in agnitione inveni eam.

verses.textEn: From the beginning, I held my heart to wisdom. Because of this, I will not be forsaken.
verses.textLa: Possedi cum ipsa cor ab initio: propter hoc non derelinquar.

verses.textEn: My stomach was stirred up while seeking her. Because of her, I will hold a good possession.
verses.textLa: Venter meus conturbatus est quærendo illam: propterea bonam possidebo possessionem.

verses.textEn: The Lord has given me a tongue as my reward, and I will praise him with it.
verses.textLa: Dedit mihi Dominus linguam mercedem meam: et in ipsa laudabo eum.

verses.textEn: Draw near to me, you who are untaught, and gather yourselves into the house of discipline.
verses.textLa: Appropiate ad me indocti, et congregate vos in domum disciplinæ.

verses.textEn: Why are you reluctant? And what do you have to say about these things? Your souls are exceedingly thirsty!
verses.textLa: Quid adhuc retardatis? Et quid dicitis in his? Animæ vestræ sitiunt vehementer.

verses.textEn: I have opened my mouth, and I have spoken. Buy wisdom for yourselves without silver,
verses.textLa: Aperui os meum, et locutus sum: Comparate vobis sine argento,

verses.textEn: and subject your neck to her yoke, and let your soul accept her discipline. For she is close enough to be found.
verses.textLa: et collum vestrum subiicite iugo, et suscipiat anima vestra disciplinam: in proximo est enim invenire eam.

verses.textEn: See with your own eyes how I have labored only a little, and have found much rest for myself.
verses.textLa: Videte oculis vestris quia modicum laboravi, et inveni mihi multam requiem.

verses.textEn: Take up discipline, as if it were a great sum of money, and possess an abundance of gold in her.
verses.textLa: Assumite disciplinam in multo numero argenti, et copiosum aurum possidete in ea.

verses.textEn: Let your soul rejoice in his mercy. For you will not be confounded by his praise.
verses.textLa: Lætetur anima vestra in misericordia eius, et non confundemini in laude ipsius.

verses.textEn: Accomplish your work before the time. And he will give you your reward in his time.
verses.textLa: Operamini opus vestrum ante tempus, et dabit vobis mercedem vestram in tempore suo.
